description: From be- (“at, on, upon”) +‎ tone. Compare German betonen.

verbs.description: betone (third-person singular simple present betones, present participle betoning, simple past and past participle betoned)

entries.meaning: (transitive, archaic) To endow with a tone; give a special tone to; place stress upon; accentuate; emphasise.
examples: The position, moreover, of the verb  […]  shows that it is to be betoned while we read and interpret;  […]
